pros: Well run hospital and very team oriented
cons: The building is old and falling apart

pros: Decent pay compared to physicians offices
Pay is decent, and pension plan
cons: Limited Opportunities for advancement Health Benefits
In transition, too small of space to grow, new hospital coming

pros: Close to home, less then 15 minute drive
cons: Under staffed, building is in poor condition
short staffed on alot of the floors at the moment

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Orillia, ON
pros: Fair wage, 12 hour shifts, great coworkers, inclusive culture, opportunity to advance
cons: Very short staffed in the laboratory, equipment in need of replacing, underfunded department

pros: I haven’t been there long enough to find anything positive to say.
cons: No descent training provided, they expect you to jump into a position and know all the ins and outs, to be super fast compromising safety, equipment in the kitchen doesn’t work properly, dishes come out dirty and disgusting, temperature is always lower then minimum requirement. Manager is border line a bully and the whole experience felt unprofessional and very uncomfortable, I never expected a hospital setting to be like this. Huge disappointment.

review_title: Very nice place to work all things considered.
pros: All of the staff are wonderful people who truly value helping people and making a difference within the Orillia community. There are opportunities to grow within the hospital if you wish to. Job openings within other departments are open first to internal employees.
cons: Dealing with difficult people is a daily occurrence. Working in healthcare is never easy, and people are often scared/angry/etc while in a hospital. However, the hospital has very good support systems to help you deal with these situations.

pros: Not all the gossip drama other hospitals have. Lots of positions to move to if youre not happy.
cons: Sometimes working in a unionized environment sucks.

pros: The hourly pay is the only thing keeping staff there, work is harsh and can be very stressful.
cons: No appreciation or respect from manager  and supervisors,  staff get written up for the most stupid reasons as walking too fast, being too friendly or not friendly enough.  Oppressive environment and unrealistic expectations, overworked and stressed staff mostly becuase management is constantly breathing down your neck.  Work load is heavy and exhausting and not fairly distributed, while a few only work one  most have to work many if not all the lines; biased behaviour and favouritism.

pros: Soldiers Memorial offers a good wage and benefits, offered to both ft/pt. Staff are caring and take the time to listen to patient needs.
cons: No longer a team in our department. Supervisor seems to make all the decisions without the support of employee feedback. Emotional upset at times

pros: The people that work there are great.
cons: Many healthcare workers are overworked and underappreciated.
